Definition: In this task, you are given a short story consisting of exactly 5 sentences. The second sentence is missing, and you are given two options to choose from. You need to select the option that best connects the first sentence with the rest of the story. If the first option is correct, indicate your answer with 'Option 1'. Otherwise, indicate your answer with 'Option 2'. The incorrect option will change the subsequent storyline, so that at least one of the three subsequent sentences is no longer consistent with the story.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence 1: The cashier was counting the dollar bills at her desk. 
 Sentence 3: Everyone panicked and started to scream. 
  Sentence 4: The men threatened the people to remain quiet. 
 Sentence 5: The cashier handed them the cash so they would go away.  
 Option 1:  Two men rushed into the store and held their guns up. 
 Option 2: Two dogs rushed into the store.
Positive Examples.explanation: Option 1 forms a consistent story with the given four sentences. In constrast, Option 2 is incorrect as the entty 'two dogs' is not consistent with 'men' mentioned in Sentence 4.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence 1: The cashier was counting the dollar bills at her desk. 
 Sentence 3: Everyone panicked and started to scream. 
  Sentence 4: The men threatened the people to remain quiet. 
 Sentence 5: The cashier handed them the cash so they would go away.  
 Option 1:  Three men rushed into the store and held their guns up. 
 Option 2: Two men rushed into the hospital.
Positive Examples.explanation: Option 1 forms a consistent story with the given four sentences. In constrast, Option 2 is incorrect as it is not consisitent with sentence 1 ('store cashier' vs 'hospital').

Negative Examples.input:
Sentence 1: The cashier was counting the dollar bills at her desk. 
 Sentence 3: Everyone panicked and started to scream. 
  Sentence 4: The men threatened the people to remain quiet. 
 Sentence 5: The cashier handed them the cash so they would go away.  
 Option 1:  Two men rushed into the store and held their guns up. 
 Option 2: Two dogs rushed into the store.
Negative Examples.output: Two men rushed into the store and held their guns up.
Negative Examples.explanation: The selected option is correct but it outputed the entire option text instead of its label i.e 'Option 1'.

Instances.input:
Sentence 1: Sally just started middle school. 
 Sentence 3: One day she got very confused about her schedule 
 Sentence 4:  She ended up at the wrong lunch 
 Sentence 5:  Luckily she made a friend who helped her figure out things 
 Option 1: She had met a cute boy named Noah. 
 Option 2: She was was a new student too.

Sentence 1: A friend sent me a princess doll for my birthday, even though I 30. 
 Sentence 3: I placed her on the mantle of my fireplace to admire 
 Sentence 4:  When people come over, they often compliment her shiny porcelain skin 
 Sentence 5:  She sits on the mantle every day, never being moved from position 
 Option 1: She was beautiful right out of the box, with long red curls. 
 Option 2: She was ugly right out of the box, with short blonde curls.

Sentence 1: Jim decided to grill hamburgers. 
 Sentence 3: He formed patties for the burgers 
 Sentence 4:  He started outside to fire up the grill 
 Sentence 5:  When Jim got outside, he realized he was out of charcoal! 
 Option 1: He bought the meat and all the fixings. 
 Option 2: He bought ready made burger patties.

Sentence 1: Susan wanted to get rid of the mice in her house. 
 Sentence 3: The next morning there were three mice in the trap 
 Sentence 4:  She carefully set them free outside 
 Sentence 5:  That night the mice came back inside! 
 Option 1: She set out a no-kill trap to capture them overnight. 
 Option 2: so she planned to caught them by making a trap for them.

Sentence 1: Drew had a bad habit of snooping on people. 
 Sentence 3: Last week, he opened Fran's medicine cabinet 
 Sentence 4:  Everything fell out and made a lot of noise 
 Sentence 5:  He was caught red handed! 
 Option 1: He would look in their drawers when he went to their house. 
 Option 2: He would behave himself when he went to their house.

Sentence 1: I went to my friend's rap concert the other day. 
 Sentence 3: A lot of people were there to see him rap 
 Sentence 4:  I was really impressed by his skills 
 Sentence 5:  I can't wait to see his next rap show 
 Option 1: He was a terrible rapper. 
 Option 2: He is a really good rapper.

Sentence 1: Gretchen the goat lived in the backyard of a sweet family. 
 Sentence 3: One day some dogs got into the back yard with Gretchen 
 Sentence 4:  They chased her and bit her until she became very exhausted 
 Sentence 5:  Gretchen's family was devastated that the dogs almost killed Gretchen 
 Option 1: Every day they would feed Gretchen and pet her. 
 Option 2: She escaped one day and ran into the woods.

Sentence 1: Roxy notices her nails look plain. 
 Sentence 3: Then she remembers she has nail polish 
 Sentence 4:  Roxy picks out a color to paint her nails 
 Sentence 5:  Now her nails are beautifully painted 
 Option 1: She paints them almost every day. 
 Option 2: She hasn't painted them in months.
